English: §RGain 3 infamy§! Loango has long undermined our authority, aiding northern insurgents and blocking trade with our kin. Such a troublesome state cannot be allowed to remain independent. Their lands are already in our hands--the final step is to proclaim Loango an integral part of our realm.

§RGain 5 infamy§! With Loango securely under our dominion and European technology now at our disposal, it is time to extend our rule further north of the Congo River Basin. Our scattered kinspeople have lacked national unity for generations. Under our leadership, they shall finally find order. Forward to the north!

§RGain 5 infamy§! Our military is now a formidable powerhouse, and our technological sophistication now rivals that of our Portuguese subjugators. The moment has arrived to cast off their yoke and liberate our cousins in the South from centuries of colonial oppression. God bless our mighty empire! God bless Kongo! To arms! §RSTART A WAR WITH PORTUGAL§W

§RGain 5 infamy§! After a brutal war, we have liberated our cousins in Angola and established uncontested supremacy over Central Africa. Our kingdom has achieved ascendancy on our continent and newfound prestige in the rest of the world. God bless the Kingdom of Kongo!

Oyo has served as the heart of our kingdom since ancient times, though Fulani conquest once forced us to abandon it. Oyo Ile belongs to us again, and its restoration as our capital naturally must follow.

§RGain 3 infamy§! The Fulani once empowered the traitorous Ilorin separatists and threatened our frontier. Securing the North is our unquestionable duty, so as to ensure Fulani-backed separatism never threatens our realm again.

French: §RGain 3 infamy§! Only decades ago, Dahomey formed part of the Oyo Empire. Our realm stands restored elsewhere, and Dahomey must also return to its rightful place under our protection as guardians of the Yoruba people.

English: §RGain 7 infamy§! With our historic lands reunited under one banner, the time has come to re-establish the empire we once proudly commanded.
§RGain 7 infamy§! Our homeland stands secure beneath our rule. It is time to extend Yoruban greatness to the surrounding borderlands and stake our rightful claims.

The Arabic script already appears widely across the country. Recognizing it as the official writing system would simply formalize what much of the nation already uses, and would further encourage literacy among the mostly-illiterate commoners.
§RGain 15 infamy§! Our core lands stand united at last. Neighboring cultures may now look to us for leadership, strength, and the promise of an even greater empire.

The Oyo Jihad has passed, and our nation endures. Southern lands once tied to our destiny lie ahead of us once more. The Egba and Ijebu broke away during long years of civil strife, but that time of upheaval has passed, and we may now pursue reunification by force.
